chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Goal:
forall x y : Z, x > 0 -> 0 > y -> 0 > Z.mul x y

Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope

Zgt_sign_pos_pos : forall x y : Z, x > 0 -> y > 0 -> x * y > 0

Zlt_sign_pos_pos : forall x y : Z, 0 < x -> 0 < y -> 0 < x * y
OMEGA7 : forall x y z t : Z, z > 0 -> t > 0 -> 0 <= x -> 0 <= y -> 0 <= x * z + y * t
Zmin_spec : forall x y : Z, x <= y /\ Z.min x y = x \/ x > y /\ Z.min x y = y
Z.compare_eq : forall x y : Z, (x ?= y) = Eq -> x = y
Z_le_lt_eq_dec : forall x y : Z, x <= y -> {x < y} + {x = y}
Z_gt_le_bool : forall x y : Z, {b : bool | if b then x > y else x <= y}
Z_le_gt_bool : forall x y : Z, {b : bool | if b then x <= y else x > y}
Z_gt_dec : forall x y : Z, {x > y} + {~ x > y}
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
Zgt_neg_pos : forall x : Z, 0 > - x -> x > 0
two_p_gt_ZERO : forall x : Z, 0 <= x -> two_p x > 0

BinIntDef.Z.ltb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Lt => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.ltb (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_lt_ge_dec : forall x y : Z, {x < y} + {x >= y}

Z.ltb_spec : forall x y : Z, BoolSpec (x < y) (y <= x) (x <? y)

Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Pos.gt = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive = Gt : positive -> positive -> Prop Arguments Pos.gt (_ _)%positive_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.ge = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.ge (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.gt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.gt (_ _)%Z_scope
N.gt = fun x y : N => (x ?= y)%N = Gt : N -> N -> Prop Arguments N.gt (_ _)%N_scope
